place.name: BUSHLEY
place.gazetteerText: BUSHLEY, a parish in Upton-on-Severn district, Worcester; on the river Severn, near the Bristol and Birmingham railway, 1¾ mile NNW of Tewkesbury. Post Town, Tewkesbury. Acres, 1,740. Real property, £3,227. Pop., 282. Houses, 63. Poll Court here is the seat of J. E. Dowdeswell, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £358. Patron. J. E. Dowdeswell, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
